columns.Aircraft_ID: A unique identifier for each aircraft entry in the table.
columns.Order_Year: The year in which the aircraft was ordered.
columns.Manufacturer: The name of the company that produced the aircraft.
columns.Model: The specific designation or variant of the aircraft.
columns.Fleet_Series: The series number assigned to a group of aircraft of the same type.
columns.Powertrain: Details about the engine or power system used in the aircraft.
columns.Fuel_Propulsion: The type of fuel or propulsion system used to power the aircraft.

aircraft.table_description: The aircraft table contains information regarding various aircraft, detailing aspects such as their identification, ordering, manufacturing, and specifications related to their construction and operation.

columns.Pilot_ID: A unique identifier for each pilot in the table.
columns.Pilot_name: The full name of the pilot.
columns.Rank: The rank or position level of the pilot within their team.
columns.Age: The current age of the pilot.
columns.Nationality: The country of citizenship or origin of the pilot.
columns.Position: The specific playing position that the pilot is designated to within the team.
columns.Join_Year: The year the pilot joined their respective team.
columns.Team: The name of the team with which the pilot is affiliated.

pilot.table_description: This table contains comprehensive records of pilots, detailing their identities, ranks, age, nationality, playing positions, join year, and the teams they are associated with.

columns.Record_ID: A unique identifier for each record in the pilot record, used for reference.
columns.Pilot_ID: The identifier for the pilot associated with the record, linking to pilot details.
columns.Aircraft_ID: The identifier for the aircraft associated with the record, linking to aircraft details.
columns.Date: The date on which the pilot operated the aircraft, marking the event in time.

pilot_record.table_description: The pilot_record table tracks the association between pilots and aircraft on specific dates, maintaining a comprehensive log of pilot activities.
